intro: Corynella paucifolia, commonly known as the few-leaved corynella, is a small evergreen shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
